intro: Loasa sclareifolia var. nemoralis, commonly known as the rocknettle, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in temperate climates.
